content.en: Splice site prediction: Scientists have been exploring the use of computational approaches to improve the accuracy of predicting splice sites in DNA. They have developed various algorithms, such as artificial neural networks, support vector machines, random forests, and convolutional neural networks, to achieve this. These algorithms, like SpliceRover and DeepSS, use deep learning techniques to accurately predict splice sites and interpret their significance. Additionally, machine learning models like Introme and CNNSplice have been developed to predict the impact of genetic variants on gene splicing.
content.da: Spliceside-forudsigelse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af computertilgange for at forbedre nøjagtigheden af at forudsige splicesider i DNA. De har udviklet forskellige algoritmer, såsom kunstige neurale netværk, supportvektormaskiner, tilfældige skove og konvolutionelle neurale netværk, for at opnå dette. Disse algoritmer, som SpliceRover og DeepSS, bruger dybdelæringsteknikker til præcist at forudsige splicesider og fortolke deres betydning. Derudover er maskinlæringsmodeller som Introme og CNNSplice blevet udviklet til at forudsige virkningen af genetiske varianter på gènesplicing.
